thread.title: Florida Tech football team focused on getting a win
thread.title_full: Florida Tech football team focused on getting a win

title: Florida Tech football team focused on getting a win
text:
Florida Tech football team focused on getting a win Michael Parsons , FLORIDA TODAY 12:20 p.m. EDT October 2, 2015 Delta State head coach Todd Cooley congratulates a player after making a play. (Photo: Courtesy of Delta State) Florida Tech head football coach Steve Englehart talks to FLORIDA TODAY's Mike Parsons and John A. Torres about what it will take to get a Panther victory over Delta State. Video by Rob Landers. Posted Sept. 28, 2015 
Another week, another big challenge for the Florida Tech football team. 
After a tight loss to No. 8 North Alabama last week, the Panthers head to Cleveland, Miss. To play No. 5 Delta State. 
Florida Tech knows it will be a big challenge but are focused on rebounding from the 1-3 start. 
“They are hungry to get a win regardless of who we are playing, I don’t know that it matters as much as us just wanting to get a win,” Florida Tech football coach Steve Englehart said. “Being 1-3 isn’t any fun, especially when we have been so close. We are so close to being 4-0. I think they are hungry to get a win and regardless of our opponent right now, they are excited and have come out and practiced hard.” Florida Tech defense needs big day 
Delta State is the one conference team that has seemed to have Florida Tech’s number, beating the Panthers by at least three touchdowns in both meetings. Last season Delta State handed the Panthers their worst loss of the season – 58-20. But Delta State head coach Todd Cooley is not taking them lightly. 
“They are a dangerous football team, very good. They are 1-3 and they are just a few plays away from being 4-0,” Cooley said in his press conference this week. “They went toe to toe with the two-time defending conference champion and had a shot to win. Their backs are against the wall, they don’t want to start out the conference season 0-2. 
“This is going to be the toughest football team we have played, no doubt in my mind.” 
Both teams come into the game with strong offenses that can put points on the board, which will put the onus on the defenses to slow things down. Delta State’s defense is coming off a shutout against Albany State and has come up with big plays all season as they are second in the conference in sacks with 10. They also have nine interceptions led by the duo of Joreco Beckwith and Greg Sims who have three and two respectively. 
“Our defense stepped up and answered the bell. We have challenged them and they have answered,” Cooley said. “We have a mature football team right now that comes in trying to get better and correct mistakes. If we keep doing that we have a chance to be really good.” 
The Panthers have done the same thing this week and feel ready for the challenge. 
“Really, really good week. Just from an intensity standpoint, from an effort standpoint, from a focus standpoint I thought it was as good as we could ask for, I really do,” Englehart said. 
TODAY'S GAME 
Who : Florida Tech (1-3) vs. No. 5 Delta State (4-0) 
Where : Parker Field-McCool Stadium, Cleveland, Miss.. 
When : 7 p.m. 
Radio : 89.5 FM, will have pregame and play-by-play. 
Online : gscsports.org/ESPN3 
Series : Delta State leads 2-0 
Players to watch 
Delta State – Tyler Sullivan. The junior quarterback leads the Gulf South Conference in passing, averaging 326.8 yards per game this season. 
Florida Tech – Mark Cato. The Panthers quarterback is banged up but performed well against North Alabama, throwing for 353 yards and five touchdowns. He has been wearing a boot when not practicing this week but will play Saturday. 
Stat to know : Delta State boast a perfect 12-0 record at home during the regular season under head coach Todd Cooley, who is 2-0 in Gulf South Conference openers. The Statesmen are 20-5 under Cooley. 6 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://on.flatoday.com/1RkvbPV TOP VIDEOS
